article.title: A star formation study of the ATLAS3D early-type galaxies with the AKARI all-sky survey

multiple_choice_question.text: Which panel shows a galaxy with a marginal detection (S/N ≈ 3) in the AKARI 140 μm band?
choices: Left panel
Middle panel
Right panel
None of the panels

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the correlation between the 9 μm and Ks-band luminosities of non-CO-detected galaxies suggest?
choices: The 9 μm emission of non-CO-detected galaxies is dominated by emission from old stellar populations.
The 9 μm emission of non-CO-detected galaxies is dominated by emission from active galactic nuclei (AGN).
Non-CO-detected galaxies contain significant amounts of interstellar dust.
Non-CO-detected galaxies have recently experienced a merger.

multiple_choice_question.text: What conclusion can be drawn from the tight correlation between infrared-derived luminosities and molecular gas masses for CO-detected galaxies?
choices: Dust in ETGs is solely produced by old stars.
Dust and molecular gas are tightly connected in local ETGs.
Warm dust heating in ETGs is uniform and consistent.
CO-detected ETGs are undergoing major mergers.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the agreement between the fixed-slope fits and the Kennicutt (1998) relation in this figure suggest about local ETGs?
choices: Local ETGs have lower star formation efficiencies (SFEs) than local star-forming galaxies.
Local ETGs have similar current SFEs to local star-forming galaxies.
Local ETGs predominantly obtain their gas from internal sources.
Local ETGs experience more bursty star formation than local star-forming galaxies.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the values of \'a\' in Table 2 represent?
choices: The slope of the best linear fits to the correlation between infrared and Ks-band luminosities for non-CO-detected galaxies.
The intercept of the best linear fits to the correlation between infrared and Ks-band luminosities for non-CO-detected galaxies.
The intrinsic scatter around the best linear fits to the correlation between infrared and Ks-band luminosities for non-CO-detected galaxies.
The correlation coefficients (R) between infrared and Ks-band luminosities for non-CO-detected galaxies.
